newsitem.title: UK: Kingfisher is haggling with Littlewoods - paper.
newsitem.headline: Kingfisher is haggling with Littlewoods - paper.

text.p: British retailer Kingfisher Plc has been negotiating to buy 135 high street stores from the privately-owned Littlewoods group but the two sides cannot agree on price, The Observer weekly newspaper said on Sunday.
"Littlewoods is not being clear about what's on offer and is expecting an unrealistic price," the paper quoted "a source close to Kingfisher," as saying.
The report said Littlewoods wanted around 600 million pounds ($973.5 million) for its stores but Kingfisher was offering less than 500 million.
Last month Kingfisher declined to comment on whether it was interested after Littlewoods said it was looking into the possibility of selling its stores.
